item.title: FragDenStaat
item.description:
Die Verfassungsbeschwerde von @Freiheitsrechte war erfolgreich: Das neue BKA-Gesetz ist in Teilen verfassungswidrig. Einzelne Befugnisse des BKA zur Erhebung und Speicherung von Daten sind in ihrer aktuellen Form nicht mit dem Grundgesetz vereinbar.
https://www.tagesschau.de/inland/bka-bverfg-urteil-100.html

item.title: Dave Rahardja (he/him)
item.description: Y‚Äôall know that CNN has a text-only web interface, right?If you want to experience how GODDAMN FAST the web can be without the tens of megabytes of adware tracking cruft and hundreds of npm dependencies, try this out:#news #web #tech #noJavascript https://lite.cnn.com

item.title: Covidiocracy
item.description: Via Tim Burke elsewhere, here are the representatives and senators from states badly affected by Helene who voted to de-fund FEMA *the day prior* to landfall.#Tennessee #TN #NorthCarolina #NC #Florida #FL #Helene #Republicans

item.title: Chlo√© Azencott
item.description: Academia has a travel problem.Attending faraway conferences is ecologically unsustainable, and creates a huge barrier to entry for people who are disabled, have care duties, or lack resources, among others.One piece of the solution is to create local satellites of major conferences. This idea has been successfully implemented in Paris for #NeurIPS for a few years, and I'm happy to have joined the advising committee of NeurIPS@Paris (Dec 4&5 this year)Check it out: https://neuripsinparis.github.io/neurips2024paris/

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: The fruit fly brain has 140,000 neurons and nearly 500 feet of wiring. Here‚Äôs my story about how scientists have drawn its map‚Äîthe first complete map of any complex adult brain. Gift link: https://nyti.ms/4gR4kx0

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
This is more evidence for the role for beta rhythms in top-down control. Prioritized items in WM were detected in the beta band.
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-024-52541-w

item.title: Today I learned
item.description:
TIL that Lise Meittner, the co-discoverer of nuclear fission, never won the Nobel Prize. She was nominated 48 times in both Physics and Chemistry.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lise_Meitner#Nobel_Prize
#til #todayilearned
https://www.reddit.com/r/todayilearned/comments/1fus65d/til_that_lise_meittner_the_codiscoverer_of/

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: "UC San Diego is committed to the highest ethical and legal standards in the conduct of research and we take allegations of research misconduct very seriously. Our Office of Research Compliance and Integrity addresses all allegations in accordance with university policy and procedures."

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: Understanding function by looking at anatomy is like trying to figure out traffic patterns by looking at printout of a road map. (Note: I'm not saying maps aren't important).

item.description: Humphrey is about to drop the sickest podcast of the year.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: The Diesel2p system (25 mm^2 field-of-view) has an 8 mm working distance air objective.That big air working distance is nice, it also lets a lot of light in from the sides. And we care about that because we use visual stimulation in our projects.Fortunately, PhD student Joe Canzano made a nice 3D printed cap for the objective that fits to the head plates that we use. You can customize it for yours.More pictures and photos are on the Nemonic discussion board: https://neuromatch.social/@sls/112629868836444772

item.title: Dr Craig Dal»ùell
item.description: ¬£22bn would be enough to retrofit around 750,000 homes to passive standards - i.e. effectively zero heating and certainly zero carbon heating. That would reduce carbon footprint by around 6 million tonnes CO2_e per year and would eliminate fuel poverty for those households for as long as they stand.¬£22bn invested in these carbon capture schemes will be used to prop up the profits of a dying fossil fuel industry that's doing its damndest to take us all with it.https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cy4301n3771o
